newsitem.title: USA: Escambia Cty, Fla., votes on tax for preservation.
newsitem.headline: Escambia Cty, Fla., votes on tax for preservation.

text.p: Florida's Escambia County has scheduled a Nov 5 referendum on a property tax increase to fund preservation of an endangered coastal prarie.
The proposal would increase the property tax rate by 25 cents per $1,000 of assessed value for five years, raising $6.5 million.

The environmental group that proposed the plan, Friends of the Prairie, is seeking additional money from the state to fund the $15 million public purchase of the 7,000-acre Perdido Pitcher Plant Prarie.

The land grows carnivorous pitcher plants, an endangered insect-eating plant that grows only in nine northwest Florida counties near the Gulf Coast. Preservationists said the plan would not only save the rare plants but would also prevent development that could ultimately increase the county's infrastructure costs.
